text: [Music]
hello I'm Robin a concierge associate
here at the AWS office in Cape Town
South Africa sometimes customers ask me
how do I disable or delete an access key
for my AWS account root user I tell them
you can disable
Oddity to access key from the my
security credentials page in the AWS
console let me show you how now in order
to disable an access key it's important
to note that that is a bring your access
key this action will leave the key on
the account in an inactive step however
in order to proceed we'll select make
inactive next to the access key that you
are disabling
to re-enable an inactive access key
choose make active
to delete an existing access game please
note that deleting an access key will
remove the access key from your account
completely before you delete an access
key you'll need to make sure that it's
no longer in use as you cannot recover
an access key after deleting it once
you're certain that the access key is no
longer being utilized click delete next
to the access key in question a warning
will appear asking if you're sure that
you want to delete the access key and
you'll be informed that any requests
signed in with access key ID and secret
access key in question both fail after
being deleted once you're sure that this
access key is no longer in use click yes
thanks for watching and have the cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
